facts.text: Review application made on 22nd August 1946 to Travancore High Court.
Notice to show cause issued on 4th December 1947.
Preliminary question as to maintainability of review decided on 29th June 1949 by Full Bench.
Original judgment and decree of District Judge, Kottayam dated 18th January 1943 holding Karingasserai meeting invalid due to lack of competent conveners and notice to all churches.
High Court judgment dated 21st December 1951 reversing District Judge, holding plaintiffs elected at Karingasserai meeting validly, defendants seceded by adopting new constitution Ex. AM.
Covenant of merger between Travancore and Cochin effective 1st July 1949, forming United State with common High Court.
Ordinance No. I of 1124 promulgated 1st July 1949 continuing existing laws.
Ordinance No. II of 1124 dated 7th July 1949 repealing Regulation IV of 1099, continuing pending proceedings.
United State of Travancore and Cochin High Court Act 1125 (Act No. V of 1125) reproducing relevant clauses.
Constitution of India 1950 making Travancore-Cochin Part B State, continuing High Court jurisdiction under Articles 214 and 225.

Karingasserai meeting August 1935 where plaintiffs elected as Malankara Metropolitan and co-trustees; disputed as not convened by competent persons and no notice to all churches especially defendants' side.
M.D. Seminary meeting December 1934 relied by defendants; plaintiffs contend not convened properly.
Defendants adopted new constitution Ex. AM in 1934, about 8 months before Karingasserai meeting.
Plaintiffs' advocate conceded no evidence that notices sent to all churches prior to 1086, justified no notice to defendants as aliens after adopting Ex. AM.
District Judge found plaintiffs created split but not aliens without ecclesiastical punishment; defendants not heretics.
Advocates agreed not to decide general powers of Patriarch under issue 11(a), only specific clauses b to h.

legal_issues.text: Whether review application infructuous due to political changes, merger, repeal of Regulation IV of 1099, and no authority to confirm judgment by Maharaja.
Whether High Court judgment erred on face of record re validity of Karingasserai meeting (competency of conveners and notice).
Whether High Court misconceived concession by defendants' advocate that plaintiffs not left church, avoiding scrutiny of plaintiffs' acts.
Whether High Court erred by deciding abandoned issues on Patriarch's general powers.

petitioner_arguments.text: Review maintainable as proceeding pending under old law continued under new ordinances and Act; revival would be governed by transitional provisions without need for Maharaja confirmation.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 8 Ordinance II of 1124; Section 8 Act V of 1125; Articles 214, 225 Constitution

petitioner_arguments.text: High Court erred on validity of Karingasserai meeting: did not address competency of conveners post Mar Geeverghese Dionysius death, no rules; assumed all non-plaintiffs adopted Ex AM without checking notice to those who didn't.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Error apparent on face of record under review provisions

petitioner_arguments.text: High Court misconceived concession: advocate argued neither party left church without ecclesiastical verdict for heresy or separation; not concession plaintiffs valid members ignoring their acts.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Order XLVII r1 CPC (Travancore equivalent); misconception analogous to error on face

petitioner_arguments.text: High Court decided abandoned issue 11(a) on Patriarch's general powers (obedience even if not canonically installed, decide faith, approve Catholicos).
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Error apparent on face of record

respondent_arguments.text: Review infructuous: no Full Bench decision under s25 Act 1125 so no review under s26; if under old Reg IV s12, fresh judgment needs Maharaja confirmation who no longer has power.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Regulation IV of 1099 ss11-12; Ordinance II 1124; Act V 1125 ss25-26

respondent_arguments.text: No error on Karingasserai: notice justified as defendants repudiated Patriarch via Ex AM.
Concession by appellants' advocate that plaintiffs not left church obviates scrutiny; affidavit/letters not part of record.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Sha Mulchand Co. Ltd. v. Jawahar Mills Ltd.

court_reasoning.text: Rejects preliminary objection: review properly instituted pre-merger, continued under s8 Ordinance II and Act; revived appeal disposed under s25 Act without confirmation needed; even if old law, s11 applies as far as may be.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Old proceedings continued as if commenced post-merger; no Maharaja power required now.

court_reasoning.text: High Court defective: superficial on Karingasserai competency/notice; reversed Dist J but didn't check notice to non-Ex AM churches or conveners' authority post Dionysius.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Error apparent on face as plaintiffs must prove own title independently.

court_reasoning.text: Misconception of concession: advocate argued no ipso facto secession without ecclesiastical verdict for both parties; High Court treated as concession for plaintiffs only, avoided dual aspect scrutiny (heresy vs voluntary separation).
court_reasoning.key_observation: Affidavit permissible; requires re-examination of plaintiffs' acts under issues 19-20.

court_reasoning.text: High Court went into abandoned issue 11(a) matters not pleaded/issued.

holdings.text: Review scope limited to new evidence, error on face, sufficient reason analogous thereto.
Errors on face found sufficient for review: defective handling of meeting validity, misconception of concession, deciding abandoned issues.
Appeal allowed, High Court judgment set aside, review admitted, entire original appeal reheard unless findings accepted.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; High Court order refusing review set aside; review application admitted; original appeal directed to be reheard in entirety by High Court unless parties accept specific findings.
outcome.costs: Appellants awarded costs of this appeal and of review application before High Court.

key_quotes.text: "This, in our opinion, is certainly an error apparent on the face of the record."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: On High Court's failure to address Karingasserai meeting validity.

key_quotes.text: "The majority judgments, therefore, are defective on the face of them in that they did not effectively deal with and determine an important issue in the case."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Ground for review on core title issue.

key_quotes.text: "In our opinion, therefore, the preliminary objection cannot prevail and must be rejected."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Maintainability of review post constitutional changes.

key_quotes.text: "We accordingly allow this appeal, set aside the judgment of the High Court and admit the review."
key_quotes.speaker: court
